content.webTitle: Arts diary: Eggleston receives US retrospective

fields.headline: Eggleston receives US retrospective
fields.bodyText: He takes extraordinary photographs of ordinary, everyday things: torn posters, old tyres, dogs trotting towards the camera. Now William Eggleston, whose saturated colour shots have influenced such film-makers as David Lynch and Sofia Coppola, will receive his first major US retrospective at New York's Whitney Museum this November. Featuring photographs taken over almost half a century, William Eggleston: Democratic Camera, Photographs and Video 1961-2008 will include more than 150 photographs, some never before seen, as well as the artist's rarely screened video diary, Stranded in Canton.
